Project Team and Roles

Please list all team members that participated in the project, including new members added since the last reporting period. If someone has left the team since the last reporting period, please include originally planned project role and enter “Withdrawn since [date] due to [reason]” in the “Role in project” column. Include Trainees and other HQP participating in the project, but you must also detail these in the accompanying HQP/Trainee Database update template.

ReportSection.name: Milestones
ReportSection.title: 1b. Project Milestones and Deliverables
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please download the following milestone template and upload it below.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Research Findings
ReportSection.title: 2. Research Findings
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Key Findings & Achievements

Please provide the key findings and achievements of your project in one or two sentences.

{$item}

Executive Summary

Provide a non-confidential Executive Summary in lay terms of your research findings and its importance to the care of the seriously ill, frail elderly and their caregivers. This information may be shared publicly in external communications (e.g., press releases, websites) (Maximum 500 words).

{$item}

Scientific Abstract

Please provide a scientific abstract describing the hypothesis, project’s major research findings and conclusion and its significance to your scientific field of study (Maximum 500 words).

{$item}

Scientific Review

Please provide a full scientific review of your research methodology, research findings, discussion and conclusion(s). In particular please discuss how these research findings have addressed/analyzed a previous knowledge gap(s) and discuss any future KT opportunities that might be investigated as a result of any novel research findings.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: KTEE
ReportSection.tooltip: 3. Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation
ReportSection.title: 3. Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Successes in KTEE

Describe the successes in the domain of KTEE achieved over this final reporting period. Provide specific examples (e.g. new products, processes or services with commercial potential; social innovations that have contributed to public policy in Canada; collaborations in technology, market development and/or public policy development).

{$item}
Dissemination of Project Research Results
{$item}

ReportSection.name: Partnerships
ReportSection.title: 4. Partnerships

ReportItem.labels: Name of partner and Type of partner <small>(i.e. indicate university, federal or provincial dept./agency, industry etc..)</small>|Included in original application? Y/N?|Cash and/or in-kind?|Amount of contributions|Period covered by contribution

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Provide a comparison of the actual cash and in-kind contributions from partners since award, with the projected commitments described in the original proposal. Explain changes in the level of partner commitment, if any. Detailed information should also be provided in the Financial Report spreadsheet.

Please carefully review information on expense eligibility, NCE-eligible partner, and contribution eligibility and valuation. Please consult your host institution’s research services unit if assistance is needed in determining eligibility and valuation of your project costs.

Tri-Agency Financial Administration Guide on the acceptable use of grant funds can be found at http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca/Professors-Professeurs/FinancialAdminGuide-guideAdminFinancier/FundsUse-UtilisationSubventions_eng.asp.

To calculate in-kind contribution amounts, please consult tri-council guidelines: http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca/NSERC-CRSNG/Policies-Politiques/orgpartners-orgpartenaires_eng.asp.

{$item}

Describe your partnership activities for this final reporting period.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Engagement
ReportSection.title: 5. Patient/Citizen Engagement
ReportSection.ReportItem:
A well designed research project necessarily involves a project team that is composed of patients, patient’s families, caregivers, knowledge users, HQP and researchers. All of these individuals should be meaningful involved and integral in the planning and execution of the research project , and/or in assisting in the interpretation and translation/mobilization of research findings. With this in mind please describe the role/activities that each patient, patient family member and other informal caregiver played in the planning and execution of the project, along with their role in the interpretation of, and dissemination of research findings. Please also reference Section 1a Project Team and Roles table if applicable.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Networking Activites
ReportSection.title: 6. Networking Activities
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Team Meetings & Exchanges

Identify any networking activity your project team undertook during this final reporting period and describe the outcomes as they relate to the completion of your project and to the development of collaborations.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Networking Planning
ReportSection.title: 7. Network Planning Information

ReportItem.options: Improvement of End of Life Care/Advance Care Planning Trajectories of Care|Improvement of Acute/Critical Care|Optimization of Community & Residential Care|Optimization of Transitions of Care

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please assess your project against the following.

Research Themes

Which TVN research themes does your project most closely fall under?

{$item}

ReportItem.options: Matching care to values|Engaging, empowering and supporting patients and family/caregivers|Improving clinical outcomes|Improving care across the continuum

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Strategic Priorities

Which TVN strategic priorities does your project most closely fall under?

{$item}

Knowledge Continuum

Please indicate the percentage of your project that addressed the following activities on the knowledge continuum:

{$item}% Knowledge synthesis
{$item}% Knowledge creation
{$item}% Knowledge translation/mobilization

ReportSection.name: NCE Alignment
ReportSection.title: 8. Alignment with NCE Mission
ReportSection.ReportItem:
TVN is a network funded by the federal Networks of Centres of Excellence (NCE) and as such must align with the mission and requirements of NCE.

Now that your project is complete, please provide a succinct update to each question below explaining how this research aligns with NCE requirements.

How has multidisciplinary and/or multisectoral collaborations enhanced this research?

{$item}

How has (or will) this research program address new and emerging ethical, legal, regulatory and social challenges?

{$item}

Now that your project is complete, has (or will) this research contribute to Canada’s visibility and reputation for international leadership?

{$item}
